dialogues.speaker: INT. COACH / MOTORWAY. MORNING
dialogues.text: A large empty coach, all dull beige seats and wood veneer makes its way along a stretch of motorway.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COACH / MOTORWAY. MORNING
dialogues.text: At the back of the coach we see a lone passenger. His eye closed, head drooped. Suddenly he raises a hand and rubs bridge of his nose. It's no use, Chris, 25, can't sleep. pulls up a set of head phones, puts them on, and presses on his MP3.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COACH. MORNING
dialogues.text: Long shot from the front of the coach, the driver's gruff face to the left, empty seats filtering away from camera, Chris' head peaking above a back seat. We hear the music from his MP3 begin to play. It's Noel McKoy's "Brighter D a northern soul track that's reminiscent of Motown and comparable to the vocal sound of Marvin Gaye. The track will play over the following opening scenes, th credits fading subtly in and out in white text.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET. MORNING
dialogues.text: We follow from behind as a hooded character walks with in through Dudlowe: a sprawling new town built in the fiftie house the east end after the Second World War.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We reveal Shifty, 25, Pakistani, as he makes his way thro those morning streets. He blows on his hands to warm them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly he ducks down and nips through an opening in a fence, making a short cut.

dialogues.text: Bird's eye view on Trevor Perry, average looking, thickse pallid skin, lying beneath the surface of the bath water, holding his nose.

A picture of Mohammed Ali next to a picture Allah. He approaches the window and looks out at the morn sun resting over a dull, featureless Dudlowe New-Town. He stands, staring.
